intro: Aedesia spectabilis, commonly known as the showy aedesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its foliage is broad-leafed and often features a bluish-green hue. Aedesia spectabilis blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of white or pale blue flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
